text: lentils are one of my go-to healthy
staples and the reason I love them so
much is because they're super versatile
they're always around and you can make
really delicious fast healthy meatless
meals using them today we're gonna make
lentil patties with lettuce and yogurt
really delicious kind of inspired by
falafel but a little bit lighter start
by chopping up two tablespoons a flat
leaf parsley rough chopped is good now
I've already cooked my lentils because I
wanted to start with them already cooled
I started with half a cup plus 2
tablespoons of lentils cooked in about 3
cups of water sort of think of it as
like pasta method you definitely want to
season your water so these are cooled to
that add half of a red onion pretty
finely diced we're going to use the
other half for serving 1 cup of fresh
breadcrumbs
season with salt and pepper add the
chopped parsley and stir to combine
we'll be adding some eggs to this to
help hold it together but I always like
to taste for seasoning for of out of the
eggs make sure everything's tasting
really delicious now to this add 2 large
eggs so the eggs are going to help
provide some structure to our patties
throw something to add a nice little
kick protein and healthy fat give them a
little whisk and stir everything to
combine now this is a great thing you
can do at the beginning of your week you
can get this mixture all the way
prepared and just have it in your fridge
and then if you need quick lunch quick
snack even or dinner you just saute them
off in your pan super convenient really
healthy this mixture is looking
wonderful but it's a little crumbly to
hold into patties so I'm going to puree
half of it in a food processor you can
also do this with a potato masher pulse
a few times mixture is all ready form it
into about 8 patties I find using 1/4
cup measures really helpful here so if
you're wanting to make this for a snack
you could use even smaller size ok
let's saute
so to saute these preheat a pan to
medium high add about a couple
tablespoons of olive oil and cook these
in batches I'm going to do about four at
a time flatten them slightly you're
looking for about a half inch here that
way they'll cook nice and evenly and
cook these so they're golden and crisps
turning once about four minutes just
give it a flip ooh beautiful golden so
to serve this instead of using
whole-wheat pita I'm going to go a
little bit lighter and just use nice
crunchy lettuce take one of the patties
I like to serve this with a dollop of
yogurt musing Greek here that's a really
nice creaminess tankiness add a little
bit of olive oil pinch of cayenne pepper
this is the other half of the red onion
we used for the mixture just thinly
sliced and caper berries one of my
favorites this adds a really nice briny
crunch looks delicious let's give it a

looking for here some lattice a little

super delicious incredibly satisfying
